Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0590 b) Date of Occurrence: 25/10/2023
c) Installation Details: Raptor Elite - AC-9567-297 at
Sector West Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 02/11/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Engine Control d) Main Assembly: Station-1 Port
e) Nomenclature: Engine Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PR-6858-A7 h) Sl No.: SN-4033-521
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 24/10/2022 l) Date of Removal: 31/10/2023
Pg No: 39 Ln No: 6 Pg No: 44 Ln No: 2
m) Manufacturing Agency: Epsilon Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year October 2020
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2521 Hrs / 1362 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Inadequate maintenance procedure resulting in improper installation
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Engine Control component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct non-destructive testing to verify structural integrity
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 14/11/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 15/11/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational usage reviewed. Component operated within prescribed limits. Concur with investigation outcome.
Date: 18/11/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid.
Date: 18/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 21/11/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
